intro: Mathieua galanthoides, commonly known as the white-flowered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and woodland settings. The flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate touch of color to the landscape.
